articles.author: Stephanie Kelly
articles.description: Oil prices dropped nearly 2% on Wednesday, eating into the previous day's gains as investors monitored developments in the Red Sea, where shippers are returning despite further attacks on Tuesday.
articles.title: Oil drops almost 2% as investors watch Red Sea developments

articles.author: Greg Bensinger
articles.description: General Motors has sued the city of San Francisco, seeking to recover more than $100 million, alleging that it was charged a higher tax bill than warranted because its Cruise self-driving car unit was improperly used to make the calculations.
articles.title: GM sues San Francisco, seeking $121 million in back taxes, penalties

articles.author: Chen Chen Lin
articles.description: Singapore households are bracing for a sales tax hike that takes effect in the new year as the government shores up coffers ahead of an expected surge in social spending in the rapidly ageing city-state in the years ahead.
articles.title: Singapore readies sales tax hike as demographic crunch looms

articles.author: Terje Solsvik
articles.description: Denmark's Maersk (MAERSKb.CO) has scheduled several dozen container vessels to travel via the Suez Canal and the Red Sea in the coming days and weeks, it said on Wednesday, in a further sign that global shipping firms are returning to the route.
articles.title: Maersk schedules dozens of vessels to travel via Suez Canal

articles.author: Jonathan Stempel
articles.description: The New York Times (NYT.N) sued OpenAI and Microsoft (MSFT.O) on Wednesday, accusing them of using millions of the newspaper's articles without permission to help train chatbots to provide information to readers.
articles.title: New York Times sues OpenAI, Microsoft for infringing copyrighted works

articles.author: Katrina Hamlin
articles.description: The world’s largest automaker will pull back into the fast lane. Toyota Motor (7203.T) risked being left behind in an electric-vehicle revolution, and new boss Koji Sato has vowed to catch up. But in 2024, his greatest asset will be the company’s lead in battery-gas hybrids.
articles.title: Toyota will engineer a half-electric renaissance

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Bassam Masoud, James Mackenzie
articles.description: Israeli forces pounded central Gaza by land, sea and air and Palestinian authorities reported dozens more deaths, with the U.N. health agency saying thousands of people were trying to flee the fighting.
articles.title: Israeli attacks in Gaza add to heavy Palestinian toll in war on Hamas

articles.author: Special Reports
articles.description: Axon CEO Rick Smith says the Taser was inspired by the shooting deaths of two school friends. It's largely a tall tale, part of a pattern at Axon, Reuters found.
articles.title: Taser maker Axon has a moving backstory. It's mostly a myth

articles.author: Wayne Cole
articles.description: Asian shares touched five-month highs on Thursday as market wagers on ever-more aggressive rate cuts extended a huge rally in U.S. stocks and bonds, but also left plenty of scope for disappointment next year.
articles.title: Asia shares at five-month highs as rate bets pile up

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un has ordered its military, the munitions industry and the nuclear weapons sector to accelerate war preparations to counter what he called unprecedented confrontational moves by the U.S., state media said on Thursday.
articles.title: North Korea's Kim orders military to accelerate war preparations -state media
